page.title: 04FARMING AN OVERVIEW
page.content: CANK FARM HAS BEEN OCCUPIED BY THE SAME FAMILY FOR OVER THIRTY YEARS IN WHICH SEVERAL CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE. OF THE TWO MAJOR CHANGES, ONE MIGHT SEE THAT OF THE CONVERSION FROM WELL - WATER, ACQUIRED BY A WINDMILL, TO THE MAINS SUPPLY AS BEING PARTICULARLY SIGNIFICANT. THIS HAS MEANT A STEADY SUPPLY THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, EVEN IN THE WINDLESS MONTH OF NOVEMBER. ANOTHER MAJOR CHANGE UNDERTAKEN IN 1980 WAS THE CHANGEOVER FROM MILK COWS TO ARABLE FARMING. THIS WAS INITIATED BY THE OFFER OF A GRANT OF A FIXED AMOUNT PER HEAD OF CATTLE SLAUGHTERED AS A MEANS OF REDUCING MILK PRODUCTION AT A TIME WHEN E.E.C. FARMERS WERE OVER PRODUCING MILK AND UNDERPRODUCING CEREALS. THE MONEY SO GAINED WAS THEN USED TO BUY MACHINERY NECESSARY FOR CONVERTING THE ORIGINAL 100 ACRES OF GRASS+100 ACRES ARABLE TO ALL ARABLE.
